io.github.utk003.util.math

Class FastMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.util.math.FastMath

  • @ScheduledForRelease(inVersion="v3.0.0")
public abstract class FastMath
extends Object
    A collection of simple math operations, optimized using heuristics or alternative calculation methods to provide approximate answers at a fraction of the computation time required by Math.

    The values returned by this class may not be exactly accurate, but they will be "close enough" and deterministic, so they can be used in situations where accuracy is secondary (but still important) to speed and repeatability (such as in noise generation).

    Since:
    3.0.0
    Version:
    July 20, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)

      • round

        public static float round(float val,
                          float threshold)
        Rounds the given float rounded to the nearest fixed-point number, if it lies within a certain threshold of that resulting number.

        If the number cannot be rounded, the input value val is returned directly.

        If the result doesn't fit into an int, the value returned by this method may not match the expected value.

        Parameters:
        val - The number to round
        threshold - The maximum amount to round up or down
        Returns:
        The rounded result, as a float

      • clamp

        public static byte clamp(byte val,
                         byte low,
                         byte high)
        Limits the given value to be between the given bounds via clamping.

        If the given value val lies outside the interval [low,high], then the "excess" is truncated. In other words, val is either rounded up to low or rounded down to high.

        If high &gt;= low, then the value returned by this method may not match the expected value.

        Parameters:
        val - The value to clamp
        low - The lower bound of the clamp operation
        high - The upper bound of the clamp operation
        Returns:
        The clamped value

      • shift

        public static int shift(int val,
                        int high)
        Limits the given value to be between the given bounds via modular rotation.

        If the given value val lies outside the interval [low,high], then the value is "wrapped" around the region until it lies within the interval. For example, shift(10, 2, 7) returns 5, as the 10 has an "excess" of 3 = 10 - 7, which then "wraps" around from the 2, resulting in 5 = 2 + 3.

        This method is equivalent to calling shift(val, 0, high).

        Parameters:
        val - The value to shift into the region
        high - The upper bound of the shift operation
        Returns:
        The shifted value
        See Also:
        shift(int, int, int)

      • shift

                         long high)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The shifted value
        See Also:
        shift(long, long, long)
